Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.Server

Class SocketClientConnection

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Observer.Observable<java.lang.String>
it.polimi.ingsw.Server.SocketClientConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class SocketClientConnection
extends Observable<java.lang.String>
implements java.lang.Runnable
SocketClientConnection is a class used to decouple the Server from the actual connection: when a new Client connects to the Server the latter creates a new SocketClientConnection. The main objective of a SocketClientConnection is to manage the exchange the messages between Server and Client using the Socket protocol, and ensuring that the connection is still active to the client. When a Client can't be reached the SocketClientConnection proceeds to disconnect every other player playing with the owner of the disconnected client.

      public void run()
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • send

      public void send​(java.lang.Object message)
      This method will send the Object to the Client though the Socket. If any problem arises, the method ends the current match
      Parameters:
      message - The Object to send

    • asyncSend

      public void asyncSend​(java.lang.Object message)
      Send of the message asynchronously
      Parameters:
      message - Message to send

    • initReadThread

      public void initReadThread​(java.util.Scanner in)
      This method start a new thread that will manage all the incoming messages from the Client
      Parameters:
      in - The already created Scanner for the Client's input

    • asyncManagePing

      private void asyncManagePing()
      Creates a new thread managing the ping. Every 5 seconds this thread send a ping to the Client, if any problem arises closes the match

    • asyncManagePong

      private void asyncManagePong()
      Creates a new thread managing the pong. Every 7 seconds the thread wakes up and check if a new pong messages was received in the last 7 seconds; if not proceeds to close the match

    • ping

      public boolean ping()
      Sends a boolean as a ping message to Client. If any problem arises during the send catch the exception and return false
      Returns:
      Describe if the ping failed for any reason

    • updatePong

      private void updatePong()
      Any time a pong message is received this method is called, and update the last time a pong message was seen

    • close

      public void close​(int gameMode)
      This method launches the complete sequence of operations to close a match
      Parameters:
      gameMode - The number of player in the match

    • closeConnection

      public void closeConnection()
      This method sends (if the socket is not already closed) to the Client an error message, then proceed to close the socket and consequently the connection

    • endGame

      private void endGame​(java.lang.Exception e)
      Method used to manage the forced end of a match
      Parameters:
      e - Exception thrown during the match

    • chooseGod

      public java.util.ArrayList<God> chooseGod​(int player, PickGodMessage pickGodMessage)
      The method sends to the Client a PickGodMessage, then parses the answer
      Parameters:
      player - Number of player in the game
      pickGodMessage - The PickGodMessage to send
      Returns:
      List of god chosen

      Returns:
